overview: The subject introduces students to the conceptual engineering design process, with an associated emphasis on realising autonomous mechanical systems. This includes clarifying the problem, ideation, concept evaluation, embodiment and prototyping. The design process incorporates concept evaluation against associated environmental, socio-economic and human factors, and safety.
In addition, to support the design of autonomous mechanical systems, the subject will cover how machines work including basics on relevant mechanical and electro-mechanical machine elements.
ilo: Describe engineering design methods that can assist the creation of mechanical systems and artefacts;
Construct well-reasoned engineering requirements for a given problem or need;
Apply the key concepts in designing and selecting basic machine elements.
Apply the key concepts in the integration of motors, sensors and independent control to achieve autonomous mechanical / physical systems;
Manage relatively complex engineering design projects.
generic_skills: The ability to apply knowledge of science and engineering fundamentals.
The ability to undertake problem identification, formulation, and solution.
The capacity for creativity and innovation.
The ability to utilise a systems approach to complex problems and to design and operational performance.
The ability to conduct an engineering project

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Assignment 1 Individual assessment. Intended Learning Outcomes (ILOS) 1, 3 and 4 are addressed in this assessment.
Assignment 2 -cumulatively developed written report project. ILOS 1-5 are addressed in this assessment.
Assignment 3 - cumulatively developed written report project. ILOs 1-5 are addressed in this assessment.
Written exam. ILOs 3 and 4 are addressed in this assessment.
assessment.hurdle: Students must receive 50% for this assessment task to pass the hurdle.

assessment.brief: Assignment 4. ILOs 1-3 are addressed in this assessment.
assessment.hurdle: Students must receive at least 50% for this assessment to pass the hurdle.

date_times.contact_hours: 48 hours of lectures, workshops and design lab sessions.
